1.value: Learner is able to Articulate the purpose of  carrying out research and its importance.
Learner is able to Outline the development of  research origins with suitable examples.
Learner is able to specify the nature of the problem
Learner is able to Compare and identify the gaps in knowledge to refine research topic
Learner is able to locate the  effective research problem by identifying the qualities of good research
Learner is able to Collect research articles on research problem using Google, Scifinder Scholar and Literature from other Libraries
Learner is able to Structure research article/thesis by citing the referred sources
Learner is able to Construct specific, measurable attainable, time bound, unequivocal, logical research thrust area.
Learner is able to Select  the suitable funding agencies that supports the thrust areas of research.

2.value: Learner is able to design an experimental structure to answer the research problem
Learner is able to collect quantitative data required for the research problem
Learner is able to collect qualitative data required for the research problem
Learner is able to Summarize features of pragmatic research as research paradigm, approach, philosophy and research methodology.
Learner is able to Summarize effective use of computer in different phases of research
Learner is able to Describe data mining techniques to extract meaningful insights from large datasets to answer research questions
Learner is able to Analyze social network data on the research problem
Learner is able to Summarize different meta-analysis techniques to combine results of multiple related studies

3.value: Learner is able to articulate the difference between Sample and Census, Sampling error and Non-sampling errors
Learner is able to Differentiate probability and non-probability sampling & Learner is able Describe the factors/determinants for deciding the sampling techniques
Learner is able to Carry out a pilot study is to examine the feasibility of an approach that is intended to be used in a larger scale study
Learner is able to Determine the sample size  for estimating population mean and population proportion for specific sample error and confidence level

4.value: Learner is able to Organize the information from a variety of sources Learner is able to Identify strategies for analysis of Data
Learner is able to Recognize different types of research data
Learner is able to Perform various statistical analysis
Learner is able to Implement the method of least squares to approximate the data

5.value: Learner is able to Explain the contents of the report
Learner is able to Differentiate the types of report
Learner is able to Articulate the Significance report writing
Learner is able to Organize the data into a presentable  results
Learner is able to Assemble the ways of presenting Tables and Figures
Learner is able to Summarize and Practice various guidance for effective documentation such as UGC guidance for research publications
Learner is able to Outline the results and defend the research work

6.value: Learner is able to Summarise nature, scope, concepts and branches of philosophy
Learner is able to Define â€œEthics
Learner is able to Describe Moral Philosophy
Learner is able to Summarise nature of moral judgments and reactions
Learner is able to Summarise Ethics wrt Science and Research
Learner is able to Summarise the concept of intellectual honesty and Learner is able to Recognize why research integrity is critical for self, science/research and humanity in general
Learner is able to Outline the results and defend the research work

7.value: Learner is able to Summarise Ethics wrt Science and Research
Learner is able to Summarise the concept of intellectual honesty and Learner is able to Recognize why research integrity is critical for self, science/research and humanity in general
Learner is able to Evaluate behaviours to identify misconducts such as Falsification / Fabrication / Plagiarism
Learner is able to Recognize redundant publications such as duplicate and overlapping publication, Salami slicing
Learner is able to Evaluate reports to identify misrepresentation of data or selective reporting

8.value: Learner is able to Articulate what is publication ethics and the importance of Publication Ethics
Learner is able to Summarise standards and best practices such as COPE, WAME Seek applicable best practices and standards
Learner is able to Classify different types of Conflicts of Interest in planning, designing, conducting, publishing and evaluating research
Learner is able to Evaluate behaviours to identify misconducts, identify problems that lead to misconducts and vice versa
Learner is able to List the types of misconducts
Learner is able to describe consequences of violating publication ethics Learner is able to differentiate between authorship and contributorship
Learner is able to Differentiate between predatory  and authentic journals Learner is able to Describe consequences of predatory journals and publishers

9.value: Learner is able to Use open access publications
Learner is able to Identify predatory journals and publishers using SHERPA/RoMEO
Learner is able to Use the database of SPPU i.e. UGC-CARE List

Learner is able to Use journal suggestion and finder tools such as JANE, Elsevier journal finder, Springer journal suggester etc. Find out new journal suggester Learner is able to Shortlist the journals as per the discipline and other relevant factors Learner is able to Choose the target journal

10.value: Learner is able to Evaluate the academic misconducts related to FFP and authorship/contributorship
Learner is able to Evaluate the conflict of interests in research
Learner is able to Evaluate case studies from across the world and India for Academic Disintegrity
Learner is able to Identify ethical and legal tools for academic writing
Learner is able to Use software tools to check for similarities / plagiarism and Learner is able to Revise their articles to reduce similarities to acceptable limits

11.value: Learner is able to List various citation and indexing databases and associated metrics
Learner is able to Shortlist journals based on different metrics such as SNIP, SJR etc.
Learner is able to Apply author level metrics
